title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Michael Penix Jr. and Drake London will return for the Falcons against the Patriots after missing last week's game.
Falcons' Drake London ranks sixth among NFL wide receivers with 78.2 receiving yards per game and two touchdowns this season.
Patriots' cornerback Christian Gonzalez prepares to face London, having not allowed a touchdown in his last 478 coverage snaps.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow believes the Red Sox are in a better position to acquire key players this offseason.
The Red Sox, under Breslow, improved by making the playoffs but face potential roster changes, including Bregman's opt-out.
Red Sox have $25 million under the luxury tax threshold and a strong farm system with top MLB prospects.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel, Patriots head coach, made changes to pregame introductions, moving away from a 24-year-old team introduction tradition.
New pregame introductions see offensive starters announced individually; Patriots also dropped the post-victory chant and traditional slogans.
Vrabel emphasizes changes aim to improve current performance, not to distance from past successes; team leads AFC East at 6-2.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm will be sidelined for a few weeks due to a lower-body injury sustained in a game against the Sabres.
Marat Khusnutdinov is promoted to the Bruins' top line to play between David Pastrnak and Morgan Geekie.
Lindholm, before the injury, had scored four power-play goals, crucial for Boston's 13th-ranked power play this season.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Salem, Massachusetts was bustling on Halloween 2025, with tourists in costume crowding downtown and participating in various festivities.
Key attractions included street performances, haunted museums, a Witches' Circle on Salem Common, and the Haunted Happenings Marketplace.
Tourists photographed costumed visitors and decorated sites like the Salem Witch Trials Memorial and the Salem Witch Museum.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused President Trump of abusing girls with Jeffrey Epstein without providing evidence in an MSNBC interview.
Moulton, running in the 2026 Democratic primary, argued Trump's corruption, saying he's in the 'Epstein files'.
MSNBC host Joe Scarborough challenged Moulton's claims, emphasizing a lack of evidence and urging focus on verifiable issues.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's murder trial begins with jury selection on November 18, following competency and pre-trial hearings.
Judge orders preservation of State Trooper Michael Proctor’s cellphone evidence, affecting multiple Norfolk County cases.
Federal materials potentially revealing police misconduct may become accessible to Walshe's defense as part of ongoing case review.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Star Market in Newton reopened after being shut down for three days due to asbestos concerns.
Inspectors confirmed asbestos was contained in a sealed area, posing no risk to customers or staff.
MassDEP continues asbestos abatement work in the stockroom with no public risk; store reopened at 10 a.m. Friday.

title: ‘He has everything to score 50’: Morgan Geekie is evolving into an elite goal scorer for Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Morgan Geekie is on pace to score 57 goals this season for the Boston Bruins.
Geekie recorded a 95.68 mph shot, the fastest in the NHL this season, against the Islanders.
Geekie is contributing significantly on power plays, notching two power-play goals this season.

title: Celtics reportedly exercise team option for 2024 1st-round pick Baylor Scheierman
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics exercised Baylor Scheierman's $2.74 million team option for the 2026-2027 season.
Scheierman was drafted 30th overall in 2024 out of Creighton where he was a third-team All-American.
Scheierman has averaged 8.5 minutes and three points per game this season with the Celtics.
